title: Introduction to typstable
text: purpose typstable produce publication-ready tables Quarto documents targeting Typst format. Typst modern, open-source, markup-based typesetting system provides alternative LaTeX rendering PDF documents. article show use typstable package.

title: Introduction to typstable
code: # Install from GitHub pak::pak("freierson/typstable")

title: Introduction to typstable
text: Create basic table tt():
code: library(typstable) tbl <- tt(mtcars[1:5, 1:3]) tbl

title: Introduction to typstable
code: tbl <- tbl |>   tt_row(row = 0, rotate = -45, align = 'left + bottom')

title: Introduction to typstable
text: Use tt_style() customize table appearance:
code: tbl <- tt(mtcars[1:5, 1:3],           col_names = c("", "Miles/Gallon", "Cylinders", "Displacement")) |>   tt_style(     striped = TRUE,     header_separate = TRUE,     inset = "8pt"   ) tbl

title: Introduction to typstable
text: Format specific parts table tt_column(), tt_row(), tt_cell():
code: tbl <- tt(mtcars[1:5, 1:3]) |>   tt_column(mpg, align = "right") |>   tt_row(1, bold = TRUE) |>   tt_cell(2, 2, background = "yellow") tbl

title: Introduction to typstable
text: Control column widths tt_widths(). Values proportional:
code: tbl <- tt(mtcars[1:5, 1:3]) |>   tt_style(stroke = TRUE) |>   tt_widths(1, 2, 1, 1)  # 20%, 40%, 20%, 20% tbl

title: Introduction to typstable
text: Add spanning headers tt_header_above():
code: tbl <- tt(mtcars[1:6, c("mpg", "qsec", "cyl", "disp", "hp", "wt")]) |>   tt_style(header_separate = TRUE) |>   tt_header_above(c(" " = 1, "Performance" = 2, "Characteristics" = 4), gap='5pt') |>   tt_column(1, width = "25%") tbl

title: Introduction to typstable
text: Group rows tt_pack_rows():
code: tbl <- tt(mtcars[1:6, 1:5]) |>   tt_pack_rows("4 Cylinders", 1, 2) |>   tt_pack_rows("6 Cylinders", 3, 6) |>   tt_column(1, width="30%") tbl

title: Introduction to typstable
text: Typst CLI installed, can export tables various formats using tt_save().
code: # Save as SVG tt(mtcars[1:5, 1:3]) |>   tt_save("table.svg")  # Save as PNG with higher resolution tt(mtcars[1:5, 1:3]) |>   tt_save("table.png", ppi = 300)  # Save as PDF tt(mtcars[1:5, 1:3]) |>   tt_save("table.pdf")  # Save Typst source (no CLI required) tt(mtcars[1:5, 1:3]) |>   tt_save("table.typ")

title: Authors and Citation
text: Filip Reierson. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Reierson F (2026). typstable: Better Typst Tables R. R package version 0.1.0, https://freierson.github.io/typstable/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {typstable: Better Typst Tables in R},   author = {Filip Reierson},   year = {2026},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://freierson.github.io/typstable/}, }

title: Better Typst Tables in R
text: purpose typstable /ˈtaɪps.tə.bᵊl/ produce publication-ready tables Quarto documents targeting Typst format. Typst modern, open-source, markup-based typesetting system provides alternative LaTeX rendering PDF documents. package allows R users create Typst tables elaborate formatting.

title: Better Typst Tables in R
code: pak::pak("freierson/typstable")

title: Better Typst Tables in R
code: # Create table with data-driven styling tbl <- tt(cars, cols = c(.rownames, all_of(style_cols))) |>   tt_style(header_separate = TRUE) |>   tt_header_above(c(" " = 1, "Performance" = 2, "Characteristics" = 4)) |>   tt_column(-1, color = "color_{col}", background = "bg_{col}") |>   tt_pack_rows(index = table(cars$brand)) |>   tt_column(1, width = "20%")

what: Knit print method for typst_table — knit_print.typst_table
title: Knit print method for typst_table — knit_print.typst_table
text: Renders typst_table use Quarto/knitr documents Typst output.

title: Knit print method for typst_table — knit_print.typst_table
code: knit_print.typst_table(x, ...)

title: Knit print method for typst_table — knit_print.typst_table
text: x typst_table object. ... Additional arguments (ignored).

title: Knit print method for typst_table — knit_print.typst_table
text: knitr::asis_output object containing Typst markup.

title: Print a typst_table object — print.typst_table
text: Prints Typst markup table console.

title: Print a typst_table object — print.typst_table
code: # S3 method for class 'typst_table' print(x, ...)

title: Print a typst_table object — print.typst_table
text: x typst_table object. ... Additional arguments (ignored).

title: Print a typst_table object — print.typst_table
text: Invisibly returns Typst code character string.

title: Create a Typst table — tt
text: Creates typst_table object data.frame tibble can rendered Typst markup. Use pipe-friendly styling functions like tt_style(), tt_column(), tt_row(), tt_cell() customize table appearance.

title: Create a Typst table — tt
code: tt(   data,   cols = tidyselect::everything(),   col_names = NULL,   col_widths = "auto",   align = NULL,   caption = NULL,   label = NULL,   escape = TRUE,   rownames = TRUE )

title: Create a Typst table — tt
text: data data.frame tibble convert table. cols <tidy-select> Columns include displayed table. Hidden columns remain available data-driven formatting. Defaults columns. col_names Optional character vector display names columns. Must match number selected columns. NULL, uses column names data. col_widths Column width specification: "auto" (default) creates equal-width columns fill container. Use tt_widths() custom proportions. align Column alignment: single value applied columns, vector alignments. Valid values: "left"/"l", "center"/"c", "right"/"r". caption Optional table caption (displayed table). label Optional label cross-referencing (e.g., "tbl-results"). escape Logical. TRUE (default), escapes Typst special characters. rownames Controls row name handling: TRUE (default) includes row names first column empty header, FALSE excludes row names, string use column header row names.

title: Create a Typst table — tt
text: typst_table object can styled rendered.

title: Style specific cells — tt_cell
text: Applies formatting individual cells. Allows precise control cell appearance including spanning multiple rows columns.

title: Style specific cells — tt_cell
code: tt_cell(   table,   row,   column,   bold = NULL,   italic = NULL,   color = NULL,   background = NULL,   align = NULL,   font_size = NULL,   rotate = NULL,   colspan = 1,   rowspan = 1,   content = NULL )

title: Style specific cells — tt_cell
text: table typst_table object. row Row number (1-indexed data rows, 0 header). column Column specification: integer index column name. bold Logical. Make text bold. italic Logical. Make text italic. color Text color. background Background fill color. align Cell alignment. font_size Font size. rotate Rotation angle (e.g., "90deg", 90, "1.5rad"). colspan Number columns span (default 1). rowspan Number rows span (default 1). content Optional content replace cell value.

title: Style specific cells — tt_cell
text: modified typst_table object.

title: Style specific cells — tt_cell
code: # Highlight a specific cell tt(mtcars[1:5, 1:3], rownames = FALSE) |>   tt_cell(1, 1, background = "yellow", bold = TRUE) #> #table( #>   columns: (1fr, 1fr, 1fr), #>   stroke: none, #>   table.hline(stroke: 1pt), #>   [mpg], [cyl], [disp], #>   table.hline(stroke: 0.5pt), #>   table.cell(fill: yellow)[*21*], [6], [160], #>   [21], [6], [160], #>   [22.8], [4], [108], #>   [21.4], [6], [258], #>   [18.7], [8], [360], #>   table.hline(stroke: 1pt) #> )   # Cell spanning multiple columns tt(mtcars[1:5, 1:3], rownames = FALSE) |>   tt_cell(1, 1, colspan = 2, content = "Combined") #> #table( #>   columns: (1fr, 1fr, 1fr), #>   stroke: none, #>   table.hline(stroke: 1pt), #>   [mpg], [cyl], [disp], #>   table.hline(stroke: 0.5pt), #>   table.cell(colspan: 2)[Combined], [6], [160], #>   [21], [6], [160], #>   [22.8], [4], [108], #>   [21.4], [6], [258], #>   [18.7], [8], [360], #>   table.hline(stroke: 1pt) #> )

title: Style specific columns — tt_column
text: Applies formatting one columns. Supports static values data-driven formatting styling parameters reference columns.

title: Style specific columns — tt_column
code: tt_column(   table,   column,   width = NULL,   align = NULL,   bold = NULL,   italic = NULL,   color = NULL,   background = NULL,   border_left = NULL,   border_right = NULL,   font_size = NULL,   rotate = NULL,   .missing = c("warn", "ignore", "error") )

title: Style specific columns — tt_column
text: table typst_table object. column <tidy-select> Column(s) style. width Column width (e.g., "100pt", "2fr"). Overrides width set tt(). align Column alignment: "left", "center", "right". bold Logical, column name, pattern string. logical, applies rows. column name (unquoted), uses column's values. pattern containing {col} (e.g., "bold_{col}"), expands column name per styled column. italic Logical, column name, pattern string. behavior bold. color Text color. Can color value, column name, pattern string. background Background fill color. Can color value, column name, pattern string. border_left Left border specification (e.g., TRUE, "1pt + gray"). border_right Right border specification. font_size Font size (e.g., "10pt", "0.9em"). Can column name pattern string. rotate Rotation angle (e.g., "90deg", 90, "1.5rad"). Can column name pattern string. .missing handle missing pattern columns: "warn" (default) emits warning, "ignore" silently skips, "error" stops execution.

title: Style specific columns — tt_column
text: modified typst_table object.

title: Style specific columns — tt_column
text: Style parameters can reference columns original data per-row values:   bg_color column hidden display used styling.
code: data |>   mutate(bg_color = ifelse(value > 100, "red", "white")) |>   tt(cols = c(name, value)) |>   tt_column(value, background = bg_color)

title: Style specific columns — tt_column
text: styling multiple columns naming convention, use {col} patterns automatically expand column references:   column mpg, looks color_mpg bg_mpg data.
code: # Instead of repetitive calls: data |>   tt(cols = c(mpg, qsec)) |>   tt_column(everything(), color = "color_{col}", background = "bg_{col}")

title: Style specific columns — tt_column
code: # Right-align and bold a numeric column tt(mtcars[1:5, 1:3], rownames = FALSE) |>   tt_column(mpg, align = "right", bold = TRUE) #> #table( #>   columns: (1fr, 1fr, 1fr), #>   align: (right, left, left), #>   stroke: none, #>   table.hline(stroke: 1pt), #>   [*mpg*], [cyl], [disp], #>   table.hline(stroke: 0.5pt), #>   [*21*], [6], [160], #>   [*21*], [6], [160], #>   [*22.8*], [4], [108], #>   [*21.4*], [6], [258], #>   [*18.7*], [8], [360], #>   table.hline(stroke: 1pt) #> )   # Style multiple columns at once tt(mtcars[1:5, 1:3], rownames = FALSE) |>   tt_column(c(mpg, disp), align = "right", color = "blue") #> #table( #>   columns: (1fr, 1fr, 1fr), #>   align: (right, left, right), #>   stroke: none, #>   table.hline(stroke: 1pt), #>   [#text(fill: blue)[mpg]], [cyl], [#text(fill: blue)[disp]], #>   table.hline(stroke: 0.5pt), #>   [#text(fill: blue)[21]], [6], [#text(fill: blue)[160]], #>   [#text(fill: blue)[21]], [6], [#text(fill: blue)[160]], #>   [#text(fill: blue)[22.8]], [4], [#text(fill: blue)[108]], #>   [#text(fill: blue)[21.4]], [6], [#text(fill: blue)[258]], #>   [#text(fill: blue)[18.7]], [8], [#text(fill: blue)[360]], #>   table.hline(stroke: 1pt) #> )   # Pattern-based styling (column-specific style columns) df <- data.frame(   a = 1:3, b = 4:6,   color_a = c("red", "green", "blue"),   color_b = c("black", "gray", "white") ) tt(df, cols = c(a, b), rownames = FALSE) |>   tt_column(c(a, b), color = "color_{col}") #> #table( #>   columns: (1fr, 1fr), #>   stroke: none, #>   table.hline(stroke: 1pt), #>   [a], [b], #>   table.hline(stroke: 0.5pt), #>   [#text(fill: red)[1]], [#text(fill: black)[4]], #>   [#text(fill: green)[2]], [#text(fill: gray)[5]], #>   [#text(fill: blue)[3]], [#text(fill: white)[6]], #>   table.hline(stroke: 1pt) #> )

title: Add footnotes to table — tt_footnote
text: Adds footnotes table. Supports general notes, numbered notes, symbol-marked notes.

title: Add footnotes to table — tt_footnote
code: tt_footnote(table, general = NULL, number = NULL, symbol = NULL)

title: Add footnotes to table — tt_footnote
text: table typst_table object. general Character vector general footnotes (markers). number Character vector numbered footnotes (1, 2, 3...). symbol Character vector symbol footnotes (*, †, ‡...).

title: Add footnotes to table — tt_footnote
text: modified typst_table object.

title: Add footnotes to table — tt_footnote
code: # Add a general note tt(mtcars[1:5, 1:3], rownames = FALSE) |>   tt_footnote(general = "Source: Motor Trend magazine, 1974.") #> #table( #>   columns: (1fr, 1fr, 1fr), #>   stroke: none, #>   table.hline(stroke: 1pt), #>   [mpg], [cyl], [disp], #>   table.hline(stroke: 0.5pt), #>   [21], [6], [160], #>   [21], [6], [160], #>   [22.8], [4], [108], #>   [21.4], [6], [258], #>   [18.7], [8], [360], #>   table.hline(stroke: 1pt) #> ) #>  #> #text(size: 0.9em)[ #> Source: Motor Trend magazine, 1974. #> ]   # Add numbered footnotes tt(mtcars[1:5, 1:3], rownames = FALSE) |>   tt_footnote(number = c("Miles per gallon", "Number of cylinders")) #> #table( #>   columns: (1fr, 1fr, 1fr), #>   stroke: none, #>   table.hline(stroke: 1pt), #>   [mpg], [cyl], [disp], #>   table.hline(stroke: 0.5pt), #>   [21], [6], [160], #>   [21], [6], [160], #>   [22.8], [4], [108], #>   [21.4], [6], [258], #>   [18.7], [8], [360], #>   table.hline(stroke: 1pt) #> ) #>  #> #text(size: 0.9em)[ #> 1. Miles per gallon \ #> 2. Number of cylinders #> ]

what: Add grouped header row above column names — tt_header_above
title: Add grouped header row above column names — tt_header_above
text: Adds spanning header row existing column names group related columns together.

title: Add grouped header row above column names — tt_header_above
code: tt_header_above(   table,   header,   bold = TRUE,   align = "center",   color = NULL,   background = NULL,   line = TRUE,   gap = "10pt" )

title: Add grouped header row above column names — tt_header_above
text: table typst_table object. header Named vector specifying header groups. Names group labels, values number columns group spans. Use empty string "" columns without group header. bold Logical. Make header text bold (default TRUE). align Header alignment (default "center"). color Text color. background Background fill color. line Logical. Add horizontal line header (default TRUE). gap Width visual gap header groups (e.g., "10pt", "0.5em"). specified, empty columns inserted groups. Default "10pt". Use NULL disable gaps.

title: Add grouped header row above column names — tt_header_above
text: modified typst_table object.

title: Add grouped header row above column names — tt_header_above
code: # Group columns under headers tt(mtcars[1:5, 1:6], rownames = FALSE) |>   tt_header_above(c("Performance" = 3, "Design" = 3)) #> #table( #>   columns: (1fr, 1fr, 1fr, 10pt, 1fr, 1fr, 1fr), #>   align: (left, left, left, center, left, left, left), #>   stroke: none, #>   table.hline(stroke: 1pt), #>   table.header( #>     table.cell(colspan: 3, align: center, stroke: (bottom: 0.5pt))[*Performance*], #>     [], #>     table.cell(colspan: 3, align: center, stroke: (bottom: 0.5pt))[*Design*], #>     [mpg], #>     [cyl], #>     [disp], #>     [], #>     [hp], #>     [drat], #>     [wt] #>   ), #>   table.hline(stroke: 0.5pt), #>   [21], [6], [160], [], [110], [3.9], [2.62], #>   [21], [6], [160], [], [110], [3.9], [2.875], #>   [22.8], [4], [108], [], [93], [3.85], [2.32], #>   [21.4], [6], [258], [], [110], [3.08], [3.215], #>   [18.7], [8], [360], [], [175], [3.15], [3.44], #>   table.hline(stroke: 1pt) #> )   # Leave some columns ungrouped tt(mtcars[1:5, 1:6], rownames = FALSE) |>   tt_header_above(c(" " = 1, "Group A" = 2, "Group B" = 3)) #> #table( #>   columns: (1fr, 10pt, 1fr, 1fr, 10pt, 1fr, 1fr, 1fr), #>   align: (left, center, left, left, center, left, left, left), #>   stroke: none, #>   table.hline(stroke: 1pt), #>   table.header( #>     table.cell(align: center)[* *], #>     [], #>     table.cell(colspan: 2, align: center, stroke: (bottom: 0.5pt))[*Group A*], #>     [], #>     table.cell(colspan: 3, align: center, stroke: (bottom: 0.5pt))[*Group B*], #>     [mpg], #>     [], #>     [cyl], #>     [disp], #>     [], #>     [hp], #>     [drat], #>     [wt] #>   ), #>   table.hline(stroke: 0.5pt), #>   [21], [], [6], [160], [], [110], [3.9], [2.62], #>   [21], [], [6], [160], [], [110], [3.9], [2.875], #>   [22.8], [], [4], [108], [], [93], [3.85], [2.32], #>   [21.4], [], [6], [258], [], [110], [3.08], [3.215], #>   [18.7], [], [8], [360], [], [175], [3.15], [3.44], #>   table.hline(stroke: 1pt) #> )   # Disable gaps between groups tt(mtcars[1:5, 1:6], rownames = FALSE) |>   tt_header_above(c(" " = 1, "Group A" = 2, "Group B" = 3), gap = NULL) #> #table( #>   columns: (1fr, 1fr, 1fr, 1fr, 1fr, 1fr), #>   stroke: none, #>   table.hline(stroke: 1pt), #>   table.header( #>     table.cell(align: center)[* *], #>     table.cell(colspan: 2, align: center, stroke: (bottom: 0.5pt))[*Group A*], #>     table.cell(colspan: 3, align: center, stroke: (bottom: 0.5pt))[*Group B*], #>     [mpg], #>     [cyl], #>     [disp], #>     [hp], #>     [drat], #>     [wt] #>   ), #>   table.hline(stroke: 0.5pt), #>   [21], [6], [160], [110], [3.9], [2.62], #>   [21], [6], [160], [110], [3.9], [2.875], #>   [22.8], [4], [108], [93], [3.85], [2.32], #>   [21.4], [6], [258], [110], [3.08], [3.215], #>   [18.7], [8], [360], [175], [3.15], [3.44], #>   table.hline(stroke: 1pt) #> )

what: Add horizontal line to table — tt_hline
title: Add horizontal line to table — tt_hline
text: Adds horizontal line specific position table.

title: Add horizontal line to table — tt_hline
code: tt_hline(table, y, start = NULL, end = NULL, stroke = TRUE)

title: Add horizontal line to table — tt_hline
text: table typst_table object. y Position line (0 = top table, 1 = header, 2 = first data row, etc.). start Starting column partial line (0-indexed). end Ending column partial line (0-indexed). stroke Line style: TRUE default, color name, full stroke spec like "2pt + red".

title: Add horizontal line to table — tt_hline
text: modified typst_table object.

title: Add horizontal line to table — tt_hline
code: # Add line below header tt(mtcars[1:5, 1:3], rownames = FALSE) |>   tt_hline(1) #> #table( #>   columns: (1fr, 1fr, 1fr), #>   stroke: none, #>   table.hline(stroke: 1pt), #>   [mpg], [cyl], [disp], #>   table.hline(stroke: 0.5pt), #>   table.hline(), #>   [21], [6], [160], #>   [21], [6], [160], #>   [22.8], [4], [108], #>   [21.4], [6], [258], #>   [18.7], [8], [360], #>   table.hline(stroke: 1pt) #> )   # Add colored line tt(mtcars[1:5, 1:3], rownames = FALSE) |>   tt_hline(1, stroke = "blue") #> #table( #>   columns: (1fr, 1fr, 1fr), #>   stroke: none, #>   table.hline(stroke: 1pt), #>   [mpg], [cyl], [disp], #>   table.hline(stroke: 0.5pt), #>   table.hline(stroke: 1pt + blue), #>   [21], [6], [160], #>   [21], [6], [160], #>   [22.8], [4], [108], #>   [21.4], [6], [258], #>   [18.7], [8], [360], #>   table.hline(stroke: 1pt) #> )   # Partial line spanning some columns tt(mtcars[1:5, 1:3], rownames = FALSE) |>   tt_hline(1, start = 0, end = 2) #> #table( #>   columns: (1fr, 1fr, 1fr), #>   stroke: none, #>   table.hline(stroke: 1pt), #>   [mpg], [cyl], [disp], #>   table.hline(stroke: 0.5pt), #>   table.hline(start: 0, end: 2), #>   [21], [6], [160], #>   [21], [6], [160], #>   [22.8], [4], [108], #>   [21.4], [6], [258], #>   [18.7], [8], [360], #>   table.hline(stroke: 1pt) #> )

what: Group rows under a label — tt_pack_rows
title: Group rows under a label — tt_pack_rows
text: Inserts group label row optionally indents grouped rows. Useful creating visual sections table.

title: Group rows under a label — tt_pack_rows
code: tt_pack_rows(   table,   group_label = NULL,   start_row = NULL,   end_row = NULL,   index = NULL,   indent = TRUE,   bold_label = TRUE )

title: Group rows under a label — tt_pack_rows
text: table typst_table object. group_label label text group (used start_row/end_row). start_row First row number group (1-indexed). end_row Last row number group. index named numeric vector multiple groups (kableExtra style). Names group labels, values row counts. Example: c("Group " = 3, "Group B" = 5) creates two groups "Group " covers rows 1-3 "Group B" covers rows 4-8. indent Logical. Indent rows group (default TRUE). bold_label Logical. Make group label bold (default TRUE).

title: Group rows under a label — tt_pack_rows
text: modified typst_table object.

title: Group rows under a label — tt_pack_rows
code: # Group rows with a label tt(mtcars[1:10, 1:3], rownames = FALSE) |>   tt_pack_rows("4 Cylinders", 1, 5) |>   tt_pack_rows("6 Cylinders", 6, 10) #> #table( #>   columns: (1fr, 1fr, 1fr), #>   stroke: none, #>   table.hline(stroke: 1pt), #>   [mpg], [cyl], [disp], #>   table.hline(stroke: 0.5pt), #>   table.cell(colspan: 3)[*4 Cylinders*], #>   [#h(1em)21], [6], [160], #>   [#h(1em)21], [6], [160], #>   [#h(1em)22.8], [4], [108], #>   [#h(1em)21.4], [6], [258], #>   [#h(1em)18.7], [8], [360], #>   table.cell(colspan: 3)[*6 Cylinders*], #>   [#h(1em)18.1], [6], [225], #>   [#h(1em)14.3], [8], [360], #>   [#h(1em)24.4], [4], [146.7], #>   [#h(1em)22.8], [4], [140.8], #>   [#h(1em)19.2], [6], [167.6], #>   table.hline(stroke: 1pt) #> )   # Using index parameter (kableExtra style) tt(mtcars[1:10, 1:3], rownames = FALSE) |>   tt_pack_rows(index = c("4 Cylinders" = 5, "6 Cylinders" = 5)) #> #table( #>   columns: (1fr, 1fr, 1fr), #>   stroke: none, #>   table.hline(stroke: 1pt), #>   [mpg], [cyl], [disp], #>   table.hline(stroke: 0.5pt), #>   table.cell(colspan: 3)[*4 Cylinders*], #>   [#h(1em)21], [6], [160], #>   [#h(1em)21], [6], [160], #>   [#h(1em)22.8], [4], [108], #>   [#h(1em)21.4], [6], [258], #>   [#h(1em)18.7], [8], [360], #>   table.cell(colspan: 3)[*6 Cylinders*], #>   [#h(1em)18.1], [6], [225], #>   [#h(1em)14.3], [8], [360], #>   [#h(1em)24.4], [4], [146.7], #>   [#h(1em)22.8], [4], [140.8], #>   [#h(1em)19.2], [6], [167.6], #>   table.hline(stroke: 1pt) #> )

what: Render a typst_table to Typst markup — tt_render
title: Render a typst_table to Typst markup — tt_render
text: Generates Typst code typst_table object. called automatically print() knit_print(), can also called directly.

title: Render a typst_table to Typst markup — tt_render
code: tt_render(table)

title: Render a typst_table to Typst markup — tt_render
text: table typst_table object.

title: Render a typst_table to Typst markup — tt_render
text: character string containing Typst table markup.

title: Render a typst_table to Typst markup — tt_render
code: code <- tt(mtcars[1:3, 1:3], rownames = FALSE) |> tt_render() cat(code) #> #table( #>   columns: (1fr, 1fr, 1fr), #>   stroke: none, #>   table.hline(stroke: 1pt), #>   [mpg], [cyl], [disp], #>   table.hline(stroke: 0.5pt), #>   [21], [6], [160], #>   [21], [6], [160], #>   [22.8], [4], [108], #>   table.hline(stroke: 1pt) #> )

title: Style specific rows — tt_row
text: Applies formatting one rows. Use row = 0 style header row.

title: Style specific rows — tt_row
code: tt_row(   table,   row,   bold = NULL,   italic = NULL,   color = NULL,   background = NULL,   align = NULL,   font_size = NULL,   rotate = NULL,   hline_above = NULL,   hline_below = NULL )

title: Style specific rows — tt_row
text: table typst_table object. row Integer vector row numbers style. Use 0 header row, 1 n data rows. bold Logical. Make text bold. italic Logical. Make text italic. color Text color. background Background fill color. align Row alignment override. font_size Font size. rotate Rotation angle (e.g., "90deg", 90, "1.5rad"). hline_above Add horizontal line row. Can TRUE default line stroke specification. hline_below Add horizontal line row.

title: Style specific rows — tt_row
text: modified typst_table object.

title: Style specific rows — tt_row
code: # Style header row tt(mtcars[1:5, 1:3], rownames = FALSE) |>   tt_row(0, bold = TRUE, background = "gray") #> #table( #>   columns: (1fr, 1fr, 1fr), #>   stroke: none, #>   table.hline(stroke: 1pt), #>   table.cell(fill: gray)[*mpg*], table.cell(fill: gray)[*cyl*], table.cell(fill: gray)[*disp*], #>   table.hline(stroke: 0.5pt), #>   [21], [6], [160], #>   [21], [6], [160], #>   [22.8], [4], [108], #>   [21.4], [6], [258], #>   [18.7], [8], [360], #>   table.hline(stroke: 1pt) #> )   # Highlight specific rows tt(mtcars[1:5, 1:3], rownames = FALSE) |>   tt_row(c(1, 3, 5), background = "#ffffcc") #> #table( #>   columns: (1fr, 1fr, 1fr), #>   stroke: none, #>   table.hline(stroke: 1pt), #>   [mpg], [cyl], [disp], #>   table.hline(stroke: 0.5pt), #>   table.cell(fill: rgb("#ffffcc"))[21], table.cell(fill: rgb("#ffffcc"))[6], table.cell(fill: rgb("#ffffcc"))[160], #>   [21], [6], [160], #>   table.cell(fill: rgb("#ffffcc"))[22.8], table.cell(fill: rgb("#ffffcc"))[4], table.cell(fill: rgb("#ffffcc"))[108], #>   [21.4], [6], [258], #>   table.cell(fill: rgb("#ffffcc"))[18.7], table.cell(fill: rgb("#ffffcc"))[8], table.cell(fill: rgb("#ffffcc"))[360], #>   table.hline(stroke: 1pt) #> )   # Add horizontal lines tt(mtcars[1:5, 1:3], rownames = FALSE) |>   tt_row(3, hline_above = TRUE, hline_below = TRUE) #> #table( #>   columns: (1fr, 1fr, 1fr), #>   stroke: none, #>   table.hline(stroke: 1pt), #>   [mpg], [cyl], [disp], #>   table.hline(stroke: 0.5pt), #>   [21], [6], [160], #>   [21], [6], [160], #>   table.hline(), #>   table.hline(), #>   [22.8], [4], [108], #>   table.hline(), #>   table.hline(), #>   [21.4], [6], [258], #>   [18.7], [8], [360], #>   table.hline(stroke: 1pt) #> )

what: Save a typst_table to SVG, PNG, PDF, or Typst source — tt_save
title: Save a typst_table to SVG, PNG, PDF, or Typst source — tt_save
text: Exports typst_table object various output formats. SVG, PNG, PDF output, Typst CLI must installed available system PATH.

title: Save a typst_table to SVG, PNG, PDF, or Typst source — tt_save
code: tt_save(   table,   file,   width = "auto",   height = "auto",   margin = "0.5em",   ppi = 144,   typst_path = NULL,   overwrite = TRUE )

title: Save a typst_table to SVG, PNG, PDF, or Typst source — tt_save
text: table typst_table object created tt(). file Output file path. format determined file extension: .svg, .png, .pdf, .typ (Typst source). width Page width. Use "auto" (default) automatic sizing based table content, specify Typst length like "6in", "15cm", "400pt". height Page height. Use "auto" (default) automatic sizing, specify Typst length. margin Page margin around table. Default "0.5em". Use "0pt" margin. ppi Pixels per inch PNG output. Default 144. Higher values produce larger, higher-resolution images. typst_path Path Typst executable. NULL (default), searches typst system PATH. overwrite Logical. TRUE (default), overwrites existing files. FALSE, throws error output file already exists.

title: Save a typst_table to SVG, PNG, PDF, or Typst source — tt_save
text: Invisibly returns output file path.

title: Save a typst_table to SVG, PNG, PDF, or Typst source — tt_save
text: .typ output, Typst source code written Typst CLI required. .svg, .png, .pdf output, function: 1 Generates complete Typst document appropriate page settings Writes temporary .typ file Calls typst compile render output Cleans temporary file width height parameters control page size. Using "auto" (default (default) creates page fits table content exactly.

title: Save a typst_table to SVG, PNG, PDF, or Typst source — tt_save
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Save as SVG (requires Typst CLI) tt(mtcars[1:5, 1:3], rownames = FALSE) |> tt_save("table.svg")  # Save as PNG with higher resolution tt(mtcars[1:5, 1:3], rownames = FALSE) |> tt_save("table.png", ppi = 300)  # Save as PDF with specific page size tt(mtcars[1:5, 1:3], rownames = FALSE) |>   tt_style(stroke = TRUE) |>   tt_save("table.pdf", width = "6in", height = "4in")  # Save Typst source (no CLI required) tt(mtcars[1:5, 1:3], rownames = FALSE) |> tt_save("table.typ") } # }

title: Style overall table appearance — tt_style
text: Sets global styling properties entire table including stroke (borders), fill (background), striped rows, spacing.

title: Style overall table appearance — tt_style
code: tt_style(   table,   stroke = NULL,   fill = NULL,   striped = NULL,   inset = NULL,   row_gutter = NULL,   column_gutter = NULL,   position = NULL,   full_width = FALSE,   header_separate = NULL )

title: Style overall table appearance — tt_style
text: table typst_table object. stroke Stroke (border) specification: TRUE default 1pt black borders, color name/hex 1pt borders color, Typst stroke specification like "2pt + blue". fill Background fill color entire table. striped Logical. TRUE, alternates row background colors readability. inset Cell padding. Can single value (e.g., "5pt") named vector different padding side. row_gutter Vertical spacing rows. column_gutter Horizontal spacing columns. position Table position page: "auto", "left", "center", "right". full_width Logical. TRUE, table spans full page width. header_separate Logical. TRUE, adds horizontal line header row.

title: Style overall table appearance — tt_style
text: modified typst_table object.

title: Style overall table appearance — tt_style
code: # Add borders and striped rows tt(mtcars[1:5, 1:3], rownames = FALSE) |>   tt_style(stroke = TRUE, striped = TRUE) #> #table( #>   columns: (1fr, 1fr, 1fr), #>   stroke: 1pt + black, #>   fill: (_, y) => if calc.odd(y) { rgb("#f5f5f5") }, #>   [mpg], [cyl], [disp], #>   [21], [6], [160], #>   [21], [6], [160], #>   [22.8], [4], [108], #>   [21.4], [6], [258], #>   [18.7], [8], [360], #> )   # Custom border color and padding tt(mtcars[1:5, 1:3], rownames = FALSE) |>   tt_style(stroke = "gray", inset = "8pt") #> #table( #>   columns: (1fr, 1fr, 1fr), #>   stroke: 1pt + gray, #>   inset: 8pt, #>   [mpg], [cyl], [disp], #>   [21], [6], [160], #>   [21], [6], [160], #>   [22.8], [4], [108], #>   [21.4], [6], [258], #>   [18.7], [8], [360], #> )   # Header separator line tt(mtcars[1:5, 1:3], rownames = FALSE) |>   tt_style(header_separate = TRUE) #> #table( #>   columns: (1fr, 1fr, 1fr), #>   stroke: none, #>   table.hline(stroke: 1pt), #>   table.header( #>     [mpg], #>     [cyl], #>     [disp] #>   ), #>   table.hline(stroke: 0.5pt), #>   table.hline(), #>   [21], [6], [160], #>   [21], [6], [160], #>   [22.8], [4], [108], #>   [21.4], [6], [258], #>   [18.7], [8], [360], #>   table.hline(stroke: 1pt) #> )

what: Check if Typst CLI is available — tt_typst_available
title: Check if Typst CLI is available — tt_typst_available
text: Tests whether Typst command-line interface installed accessible.

title: Check if Typst CLI is available — tt_typst_available
code: tt_typst_available(typst_path = NULL)

title: Check if Typst CLI is available — tt_typst_available
text: typst_path Optional path Typst executable. NULL, searches typst system PATH.

title: Check if Typst CLI is available — tt_typst_available
text: TRUE Typst available, FALSE otherwise.

title: Check if Typst CLI is available — tt_typst_available
code: # Check if Typst is installed if (tt_typst_available()) {   message("Typst is available") } else {   message("Typst not found - install from https://typst.app/") } #> Typst is available

what: Add vertical line to table — tt_vline
title: Add vertical line to table — tt_vline
text: Adds vertical line specific position table.

title: Add vertical line to table — tt_vline
code: tt_vline(table, x, start = NULL, end = NULL, stroke = TRUE)

title: Add vertical line to table — tt_vline
text: table typst_table object. x Position line (0 = first column, 1 = first column, etc.). start Starting row partial line (0-indexed, 0 = header). end Ending row partial line. stroke Line style: TRUE default, color name, full stroke spec.

title: Add vertical line to table — tt_vline
text: modified typst_table object.

title: Add vertical line to table — tt_vline
code: # Add line after first column tt(mtcars[1:5, 1:3], rownames = FALSE) |>   tt_vline(1) #> #table( #>   columns: (1fr, 1fr, 1fr), #>   stroke: none, #>   table.vline(x: 1), #>   table.hline(stroke: 1pt), #>   [mpg], [cyl], [disp], #>   table.hline(stroke: 0.5pt), #>   [21], [6], [160], #>   [21], [6], [160], #>   [22.8], [4], [108], #>   [21.4], [6], [258], #>   [18.7], [8], [360], #>   table.hline(stroke: 1pt) #> )   # Add partial vertical line (data rows only) tt(mtcars[1:5, 1:3], rownames = FALSE) |>   tt_vline(1, start = 1) #> #table( #>   columns: (1fr, 1fr, 1fr), #>   stroke: none, #>   table.vline(x: 1, start: 1), #>   table.hline(stroke: 1pt), #>   [mpg], [cyl], [disp], #>   table.hline(stroke: 0.5pt), #>   [21], [6], [160], #>   [21], [6], [160], #>   [22.8], [4], [108], #>   [21.4], [6], [258], #>   [18.7], [8], [360], #>   table.hline(stroke: 1pt) #> )

title: Set proportional column widths — tt_widths
text: Sets column widths proportions fill page container width. Widths converted Typst fr (fractional) units.

title: Set proportional column widths — tt_widths
code: tt_widths(table, ...)

title: Set proportional column widths — tt_widths
text: table typst_table object. ... Width values numbers. Can unnamed (applied order) named column. Values represent relative proportions.

title: Set proportional column widths — tt_widths
text: modified typst_table object.

title: Set proportional column widths — tt_widths
text: Widths relative proportions, absolute values. example, tt_widths(tbl, 1, 2, 1) creates columns 25%, 50%, 25% container width.

title: Set proportional column widths — tt_widths
code: # Equal widths tt(mtcars[1:5, 1:3], rownames = FALSE) |> tt_widths(1, 1, 1) #> #table( #>   columns: (1fr, 1fr, 1fr), #>   stroke: none, #>   table.hline(stroke: 1pt), #>   [mpg], [cyl], [disp], #>   table.hline(stroke: 0.5pt), #>   [21], [6], [160], #>   [21], [6], [160], #>   [22.8], [4], [108], #>   [21.4], [6], [258], #>   [18.7], [8], [360], #>   table.hline(stroke: 1pt) #> )   # Proportional widths (25%, 50%, 25%) tt(mtcars[1:5, 1:3], rownames = FALSE) |> tt_widths(1, 2, 1) #> #table( #>   columns: (1fr, 2fr, 1fr), #>   stroke: none, #>   table.hline(stroke: 1pt), #>   [mpg], [cyl], [disp], #>   table.hline(stroke: 0.5pt), #>   [21], [6], [160], #>   [21], [6], [160], #>   [22.8], [4], [108], #>   [21.4], [6], [258], #>   [18.7], [8], [360], #>   table.hline(stroke: 1pt) #> )   # Named columns tt(mtcars[1:5, 1:3], rownames = FALSE) |> tt_widths(mpg = 1, cyl = 2, disp = 1) #> #table( #>   columns: (1fr, 2fr, 1fr), #>   stroke: none, #>   table.hline(stroke: 1pt), #>   [mpg], [cyl], [disp], #>   table.hline(stroke: 0.5pt), #>   [21], [6], [160], #>   [21], [6], [160], #>   [22.8], [4], [108], #>   [21.4], [6], [258], #>   [18.7], [8], [360], #>   table.hline(stroke: 1pt) #> )
